Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the interior is ribbed and encrusted with a brown-grey granular deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394140) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394140)
